page.para: The chil/dren are play/ing hide-and-seek. It is Chi/so/mo’s turn to hide.
She hides a/mong the maize plants. Can you see her?
Da/li/tso and Chi/fu/ndo shout her name. Chi/so/mo does not an/swer.
She does not make a sound. Not e/ven when an ant bites her foot!
But it is hot, and Chi/so/mo feels sleep/y. Soon she is fast a/sleep.
When she wakes up, it is al/most dark. She is all a/lone.
Chi/so/mo starts to cry. They have for/got/ten her!
Then she hears her dad. “Chi/so/mo, Chi/so/mo, where are you?” he calls.
“I am here, dad!” shouts Chi/so/mo. And ver/y soon dad finds her.
“You are safe now,” says dad. Chi/so/mo says noth/ing. She just cries and cries.
